Module simpletimeapi
Package simpletimeapi

Interface Time

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<Time>
public interface Time extends Comparable<Time>
The unit of points in Time (instant; like java.time.Instant). All Time instances are ALWAYS normalized. Normalizing results in:
  • The range for the hours field is [0, 24)
  • The range for the minutes field is [0, 60)
Hint to implementer: Assuming that you have a constructor that takes an hours and a minutes parameter, compute the total number of minutes. If this total is less than 0 or greater equal than 24 * 60, an IllegalArgumentException with an appropriate message should be thrown. Otherwise, compute the number of hours and minutes from this total. This implies that negative minutes as parameter value might be allowed.
Author:
Richard van den Ham r.vandenham@fontys.nl, Pieter van den Hombergh p.vandenhombergh@fontys.nl

  • Method Details

    • addTime

      Time addTime(Time t)
      A given time is added to this time. The result is returned as a new Time object. If you add 2 hours to a time of 23:00, the result should be 01:00
      Parameters:
      t - The time that will be added to this time.
      Returns:
      The Time object as a result of adding t to this time.

    • addTime

      Time addTime(int minutes)
      Add number of minutes to this time. The result is returned as a new Time object. If you add 120 minutes to a time of 23:00, the result should be 01:00
      Parameters:
      minutes - The amount to add to this time.
      Returns:
      The new Time object

    • getHours

      int getHours()
      Getter for hours of this Time. E.g. Time 23:34 will return value 23.
      Returns:
      hour value of this Time object.

    • getMinutes

      int getMinutes()
      Getter for minutes of this Time. E.g. Time 23:34 will return value 34.
      Returns:
      minutes value of this Time object.

    • asMinutes

      default int asMinutes()
      Return the number of minutes since midnight. E.g. 02:40 returns 160 minutes.
      Returns:
      the minutes

    • until

      Duration until(Time other)
      Compute the distance to a point in the future from this time, expressed as duration. For example if you have a time object (13, 30) and until( 14, 20) the return will be 50 minutes. The Duration until a time that is smaller than this time itself is considered as a Duration till a Time on the next day. E.g 23:59 until 0:04 results in a Duration of 0:05.
      Parameters:
      other - time after this time
      Returns:
      the time difference as duration.
